stadium.name: The Old Fort
stadium.description: The team plays within the crumbling, stone-ringed ruins of an ancient hill-fort. The 'runes' are just old, weathered carvings on the standing stones that serve as obstacles.

stats.pregame_ritual: Reciting the names of legendary Trollball players of the past.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.
Tracing an invisible, complex sigil over their heart.
Patting every beast of burden they see on the way to the match.
Collecting a pebble from every field they've ever played on.
Leading the team in a synchronized chant that slowly gets louder.
Spitting into their own hand and then slapping their face with it.
Reciting the names of legendary Trollball players of the past.
Braiding their hair into tight, battle-ready rows.
A toast of goat's milk to the health of their rivals.
Sharing a ceremonial, non-alcoholic grog from a communal cup.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.
Tracing an invisible, complex sigil over their heart.
Collecting a pebble from every field they've ever played on.

Sharing a ceremonial, non-alcoholic grog from a communal cup.
Patting every beast of burden they see on the way to the match.

stadium.name: The Guilder's Field
stadium.description: An opulent stadium sponsored by the powerful Merchant's Guild. The stands feature luxurious, velvet-lined boxes for bankers, who are often more focused on making deals than the game.

stats.pregame_ritual: Washing their hands with dirt.
Eating a dandelion, stem and all.
Lighting a small piece of parchment on fire and inhaling the smoke.
Meticulously cleaning each stud on their boots with a special brush.
Eating a raw onion, layer by layer, without crying.
Getting a teammate to pour a bucket of cold water over their head.
A team-wide moment of absolute silence to 'gather their thoughts'.
Sharpening the edges of their blunted weapon (an exercise in futility).
Humming a tune they believe only they know.
Lighting a small piece of parchment on fire and inhaling the smoke.
Avoiding eye contact with anyone wearing the color green.
Eating a dandelion, stem and all.

preGame:
### üéôÔ∏è Welcome to the Season Finale, Sports Fans! Well, hello there, boys and girls, demons and deviants! It is a glorious, blood-soaked Tuesday night in the Everwar! I'm your host, Nok the Corrupter, coming to you live from the atmospheric (and quite frankly, crumbling) ruins of **The Old Fort** in Kerlauger! The fog is so thick you could carve it with a sacrificial dagger, and the footing is about as steady as a hero's moral compass! üå´Ô∏èüíÄ

Tonight we have a real humdinger of a match-up! The **New Prosperity Profits** are in town, and I can tell you, the Merchant's Guild has spared no expense on the pre-game festivities. I just saw Yoshi Cathy polish off a whole raw onion without shedding a single tear‚Äîthat's the kind of cold-blooded determination that makes a demon‚Äôs heart skip a beat! Meanwhile, over in the Profits' dugout, Abramson Doxia is sharpening a blunted sword. It‚Äôs a completely futile exercise, much like trying to get a straight answer out of Chairman Brennen Farno, but you‚Äôve gotta love the spirit! üßÖ‚öîÔ∏è

But don't count out our hosts, the **Kerlauger Runeguard**! They‚Äôve been busy with their own rituals. Johnna Beetner is wandering the field collecting pebbles‚Äîmaybe she‚Äôs planning on stoning a saint later? We can only hope! And listen to that! Harilda Sigsmond is leading a synchronized chant that‚Äôs getting louder by the second. It‚Äôs enough to wake the dead, which, in Osterra, happens about every twenty minutes anyway! ü™®üó£Ô∏è

And the best part? It‚Äôs an **OPEN BAR** tonight! The taps are wide open, and the ale is flowing faster than the river Styx! Whether you're a fan of the Profits' gold or the Runeguard's ancient stones, everyone‚Äôs going home blurry-eyed‚Äîif they go home at all! It's the final week before the playoffs, and the tension is high enough to snap a dragon‚Äôs neck! Let‚Äôs get some Trollball action! üç∫üèà
postGame:
### üèüÔ∏è A Drunken Masterpiece at the Old Fort! 

What a way to close out the regular season! If you like your sports with a side of staggering and a heavy dose of blunt-force trauma, tonight was your Christmas! The Kerlauger Runeguard didn't just win; they dismantled the New Prosperity Profits with a final score of **8 to 1**! It was a performance so dominant it would make Sir Garon Ironrock blush‚Äîif that old door-lover had any blood left in his cheeks! üè∞üí•

Things started fast and loose when Lashondra Niehaus snatched up the Trollball right in the center. But the highlight of the early minutes was Krueger Jacinthe of the Profits absolutely leveling Shepperd Trefler! The sound of that impact was like a choir of angels hitting a brick wall. That‚Äôs the kind of 'heroic' action I love to see‚Äîjust pure, unadulterated violence! üé∫üëä

Once the open bar started taking its toll, the game turned into a beautiful, swaying ballet of chaos. Lon Gabriell opened the scoring for Kerlauger with a beautiful long-range shot from the home field. I haven't seen a shot that accurate since Nikos Thanae last cleared a sidewalk! The crowd went wild, and the players went straight for the kegs! üéØüçª

The fog and the booze really started to mix when Vivia Namara, looking remarkably tipsy, put another one through the hoop! It‚Äôs hard enough to hit a basket in this fog, but doing it while the stadium is spinning? That‚Äôs professional grade, folks! The Profits looked like they were swimming in gold-plated molasses. üå´Ô∏èüòµ‚Äçüí´

The Profits did manage one shining moment of glory. Boleslaw Heathcote, stumbling around in a drunken stupor that would impress even the most seasoned pirate, managed to advance the ball all the way to the end zone for a thunderous dunk! It was their only point of the night, but by the Great Abyss, it was a pretty one! üèÄüî•

However, the Runeguard defense was just too much. Faina Hendrix decided he‚Äôd had enough of Reginauld Cordell's face and sent him to the healer's tent with a tackle that surely rattled some teeth! I bet even Colm, that cursed fellow, felt that one from wherever he‚Äôs hiding! The violence was top-shelf, just like the liquor! üöëü§ï

Halftime came and went, but the sobriety didn't return! If anything, the break just gave everyone a chance to refill their mugs. Lorilee Aldred came out swinging‚Äîliterally‚Äîtackling Aufmann Tedric so hard that the poor Profit had to be hauled off the field. It‚Äôs a good thing we have healers, or there wouldn't be anyone left to pay the bar tab! üç∫üî®

As the second half wore on, the Runeguard just poured it on. Vivia Namara scored again, this time from the 2-point line, looking like she was seeing three goals and luckily aiming for the middle one! The Profits' defense was as porous as Brennen Farno‚Äôs excuses for his 'kissless' status. It was a total breakdown of guild discipline! üìâü§°

Benjie Foulk joined the party late in the game, nailing another shot from center field while practically horizontal! By this point, half the players were stumbling around in a daze, and the other half were trying to tackle the standing stones thinking they were opponents. The 'Ancient Ruins' modifier really adds a layer of danger when you're three sheets to the wind! üè∫ü•¥

The game ended with Shepperd Trefler‚Äîmiraculously back from his injury‚Äîtaking a wild shot that missed by a mile, but who cares? The Runeguard had already secured the blowout! A staggering 8-1 victory for the home team, leaving the Profits to count their losses instead of their coins tonight. üí∞üö´

So, as we head into the playoffs, keep your eyes on Kerlauger! If they can play this well while intoxicated, imagine what they‚Äôll do when there's a trophy on the line! And to the New Prosperity Profits: maybe next time, spend a little less on the pre-game onions and a little more on tackle practice! This is Nok the Corrupter, signing off! Stay brutal, Osterra! üíÄüèÅ
